gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The layer was created to visually represent, as accurately as possible, the electric service territories served by the regulated electric service providers in the state of Indiana, pursuant to Cause Number 42868 (Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission) to establish an online GIS mapping environment to house, edit, and display visual interpretations or electric service territory rulings filed before and ruled by the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission. The data represented in this layer is strictly a visual aide and a best interpretation of the legally approved Electric Service Territories as ruled by the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC). These data are not legally binding or necessarily fully representative of the legal rulings. These data were provided by personnel of the IURC on May 21, 2007, and subsequently updated on February 19, 2014, June 11, 2014, August 6, 2014, and April 14, 2015.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The layer was created to visually represent, as accurately as possible, the electric service territories served by the regulated electric service providers in the state of Indiana, pursuant to Cause Number 42868 (Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission) to establish an online GIS mapping environment to house, edit, and display visual interpretations or electric service territory rulings filed before and ruled by the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission. The data represented in this layer is strictly a visual aide and a best interpretation of the legally approved Electric Service Territories as ruled by the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC). These data are not legally binding or necessarily fully representative of the legal rulings. The following is excerpted from metadata provided by the IURC: "IN THE MATTER OF THE JOINT PETITION OF ELECTRICITY SUPPLIERS FOR (1) THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE PROCEDURES TO APPROVE SERVICE AREA BOUNDARY AGREEMENTS UNDER IC 8-1-2.3-6(2) AND SERVICE CONSENTS UNDER IC 8-1-2.3-4(A), AND (2) MODIFICATION OF THE FORM AND MAINTENANCE OF MAPS OF ASSIGNED SERVICE AREAS ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO IC 8-1-2.3-1, ET SEQ. AND THE COMMISSION'S FEBRUARY 19, 1981 ORDER IN CAUSE NO. 36299"

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Initial data conversion in 2007 perfomed by WTH Engineering, Polis Center, and Chamberlin GIS Solutions

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: The data represented in this layer is strictly a visual aide and a best interpretation of the legally approved Electric Service Territories as ruled by the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC). These data are not legally binding or necessarily fully representative of the legal rulings. Citizens may contact the IURC to gain hard copy or electronic copies of the actual service territories as ruled and determined by the IURC.

CREDIT It is requested that the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC) be cited in any products generated from this data set. The following source citation should be included: [ELECTRIC_SERVICE_TERRITORIES_IURC_IN: Electric Service Territories in Indiana (Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission, Polygon Shapefile), 20150414].

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Information provided in this layer is available for public consumption. It is not private or confidential.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 10.3

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: A shapefile named "EST_Dissolved.shp," showing electric service territories in Indiana, together with an accompanying metadata file, were obtained by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey from personnel of the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC). The shapefile and metadata were renamed and the metadata were revised in accordance with standards of the Indiana Geological Survey.

A shapefile named "Electric_Service_Terr.shp," showing electric service territories in Indiana was obtained by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey from personnel of the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC) on February 19, 2014. The attribute fields named "ParentID" and "Document_L" were deleted from the shapefile attribute table. The shapefile was then renamed and the metadata were revised in accordance with standards of the Indiana Geological Survey.

A shapefile named "Electric_Service_Terr.shp," showing electric service territories in Indiana was obtained by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey from personnel of the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC) on June 11, 2014. The attribute fields named "ParentID" and "Document_L" were deleted from the shapefile attribute table. The shapefile was then renamed and the metadata were revised in accordance with standards of the Indiana Geological Survey.

A shapefile named "Electric_Service_Terr.shp," showing electric service territories in Indiana was obtained by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey from personnel of the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC) on August 06, 2014. The attribute fields named "ParentID" and "Document_L" were deleted from the shapefile attribute table. The shapefile was then renamed and the metadata were revised in accordance with standards of the Indiana Geological Survey.

A shapefile named "Electric_Service_Terr.shp," showing electric service territories in Indiana was obtained by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey from personnel of the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC) on April 14, 2015. The empty attribute fields named "ParentID" and "Document_L" were deleted from the shapefile attribute table. Esri ArcCatalog was then used to reproject the data from WGS 1984 (Web Mercator Auxiliary Sphere) to NAD 1983 UTM Zone 16N coordinate system. The shapefile was then renamed and the metadata were revised in accordance with standards of the Indiana Geological Survey.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) an MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.
Polygons showing electric service territories in Indiana

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
